info.title: AppPlatformManagementClient
info.description: REST API for Azure Spring Apps

get.description: Get a Service and its properties.

200.description: Success. The response describes the corresponding Service.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Create a new Service or update an exiting Service.

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Parameters for the create or update operation

200.description: Success. The response describes the updated Service.

201.description: Created. The response describes the new Service and contains an Azure-AsyncOperation header to query the operation result.

202.description:
Accepted. The response indicates the exiting Service is now updating and contains a Location
header to query the operation result.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: Success. The response indicates the resource is deleted successfully.

202.description: Accepted. The response indicates the delete operation is performed in the background.

204.description: Success. The response indicates the resource is already deleted.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Operation to update an exiting Service.

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Parameters for the update operation

200.description: Success. The response describes the updated Service.

202.description:
Accepted. The response indicates the exiting Service is now updating and contains a Location
header to query the operation result.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: List test keys for a Service.

200.description: Success. The response describes the test keys.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Regenerate a test key for a Service.

parameters.name: regenerateTestKeyRequest
parameters.description: Parameters for the operation

200.description: Success.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Disable test endpoint functionality for a Service.

200.description: Success

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Enable test endpoint functionality for a Service.

200.description: Success

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Stop a Service.

202.description: Accepted. The response indicates the stop operation is performed in the background.

404.description: Not found. The response indicates the service does not exist.

409.description: Conflict. The response indicates the exiting Service is now updating.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Start a Service.

202.description: Accepted. The response indicates the stop operation is performed in the background.

404.description: Not found. The response indicates the service does not exist.

409.description: Conflict. The response indicates the exiting Service is now updating.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the config server and its properties.

200.description: Success. The response describes the corresponding Config Server.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update the config server.

parameters.name: configServerResource
parameters.description: Parameters for the update operation

200.description: Success. The response describes the updated Config Server.

202.description:
Accepted. The response indicates the exiting Config Server is now updating and contains a Location
header to query the operation result.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: configServerResource
parameters.description: Parameters for the update operation

200.description: Success. The response describes the updated Config Server.

202.description:
Accepted. The response indicates the exiting Config Server is now updating and contains a Location
header to query the operation result.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Check if the config server settings are valid.

parameters.name: configServerSettings
parameters.description: Config server settings to be validated

200.description: Success. The response describes the validation result of Config Server.

202.description: Accepted. The response indicates the ConfigServerSetting is validating.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the Application Configuration Service and its properties.

200.description: Success. The response describes the corresponding Application Configuration Service.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Create the default Application Configuration Service or update the existing Application Configuration Service.

parameters.name: configurationServiceResource
parameters.description: Parameters for the update operation

200.description: Success. The response describes the updated Application Configuration Service.

201.description: Created. The response describes the new Service and contains an Azure-AsyncOperation header to query the operation result.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Disable the default Application Configuration Service.

200.description: Success. The response indicates the default Application Configuration Service has deleted.

202.description: Accepted. The response indicates the default Application Configuration Service is now deleting.

204.description: Success. The response indicates the default Application Configuration Service doesn't exist or has deleted.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Handles requests to list all resources in a Service.

200.description: Success. The response describes the list of configuration service in the Service.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Check if the Application Configuration Service settings are valid.

parameters.name: settings
parameters.description: Application Configuration Service settings to be validated

200.description: Success. The response describes the validation result of Application Configuration Service.

202.description: Accepted. The response indicates the ConfigurationServiceSettings is validating.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the Service Registry and its properties.

200.description: Success. The response describes the corresponding Service Registry.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Create the default Service Registry or update the existing Service Registry.

200.description: Success. The response describes the updated Service Registry.

201.description: Created. The response describes the new created Service Registry and contains an Azure-AsyncOperation header to query the operation result.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: Success. The response indicates the default Service Registries has deleted.

202.description: Accepted. The response indicates the default Service Registries is now deleting.

204.description: Success. The response indicates the default Service Registries doesn't exist or has deleted.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Handles requests to list all resources in a Service.

200.description: Success. The response describes the list of Service Registry resources in the Service.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

Accepted. The response indicates the exiting storage is now updating and contains a Location
header to query the operation result.

204.description: No content. The response indicates the storage doesn't exist.

buildResultId.description: Resource id of an existing succeeded build result under the same Spring instance.

server.description: The name of the registry that contains the container image

containerImage.description: Container image of the custom container. This should be in the form of <repository>:<tag> without the server name of the registry

command.description: Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. The docker image's ENTRYPOINT is used if this is not provided.

args.description: Arguments to the entrypoint. The docker image's CMD is used if this is not provided.

languageFramework.description: Language framework of the container image uploaded

username.description: The username of the image registry credential

password.description: The password of the image registry credential

resourceRequests.description: The requested resource quantity for required CPU and Memory. It is recommended that using this field to represent the required CPU and Memory, the old field cpu and memoryInGB will be deprecated later.

livenessProbe.description: Periodic probe of App Instance liveness. App Instance will be restarted if the probe fails. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

readinessProbe.description: Periodic probe of App Instance service readiness. App Instance will be removed from service endpoints if the probe fails. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

startupProbe.description: StartupProbe indicates that the App Instance has successfully initialized. If specified, no other probes are executed until this completes successfully. If this probe fails, the Pod will be restarted, just as if the livenessProbe failed. This can be used to provide different probe parameters at the beginning of a App Instance's lifecycle, when it might take a long time to load data or warm a cache, than during steady-state operation. This cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Optional duration in seconds the App Instance needs to terminate gracefully. May be decreased in delete request. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). If this value is nil, the default grace period will be used instead. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the App Instance are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. Defaults to 90 seconds.

Probe.description: Probe describes a health check to be performed against an App Instance to determine whether it is alive or ready to receive traffic.

disableProbe.description: Indicate whether the probe is disabled.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the App Instance has started before probes are initiated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Minimum value is 1.

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Minimum value is 1.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Minimum value is 1.

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Must be 1 for liveness and startup. Minimum value is 1.

type.description: The type of the action to take to perform the health check.

HTTPGetAction.description: HTTPGetAction describes an action based on HTTP Get requests.

path.description: Path to access on the HTTP server.

scheme.description:
Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Defaults to HTTP.

Possible enum values:
 - `"HTTP"` means that the scheme used will be http://
 - `"HTTPS"` means that the scheme used will be https://

ExecAction.description: ExecAction describes a "run in container" action.

command.description: Command is the command line to execute inside the container, the working directory for the command is root ('/') in the container's filesystem. The command is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions ('|', etc) won't work. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.

TCPSocketAction.description: TCPSocketAction describes an action based on opening a socket

ContainerProbeSettings.description: Container liveness and readiness probe settings

disableProbe.description: Indicates whether disable the liveness and readiness probe

reason.description: Failed reason of the deployment instance

discoveryStatus.description: Discovery status of the deployment instance

startTime.description: Start time of the deployment instance

zone.description: Availability zone information of the deployment instance

deployments.description: A list of deployment resource ids.

memory.description: Required memory. 1 GB can be represented by 1Gi or 1024Mi. This should be {512Mi, 1Gi, 2Gi} for Basic tier, and {512Mi, 1Gi, 2Gi, ..., 8Gi} for Standard tier.

duration.description: Duration of your JFR. 1 min can be represented by 1m or 60s.

aggregationType.description: Only provide one value for this field. Valid values: Average, Minimum, Maximum, Total, Count.

fillGapWithZero.description: Optional. If set to true, then zero will be returned for time duration where no metric is emitted/published.

sourceMdmNamespace.description: Name of the MDM namespace. Optional.

locations.description: Gets the set of locations that the SKU is available.

locationInfo.description: Gets a list of locations and availability zones in those locations where the SKU is available.

restrictions.description:
Gets the restrictions because of which SKU cannot be used. This is
empty if there are no restrictions.

default.description: Gets or sets the default.

scaleType.description: Gets or sets the type of the scale.

zones.description: Gets list of availability zones where the SKU is supported.

zoneDetails.description: Gets details of capabilities available to a SKU in specific zones.

ResourceSkuRestrictions.description: Restrictions where the SKU cannot be used

type.description: Gets the type of restrictions. Possible values include: 'Location', 'Zone'

values.description:
Gets the value of restrictions. If the restriction type is set to
location. This would be different locations where the SKU is restricted.

restrictionInfo.description: Gets the information about the restriction where the SKU cannot be used.

reasonCode.description: Gets the reason for restriction. Possible values include: 'QuotaId', 'NotAvailableForSubscription'

ResourceSkuZoneDetails.description: Details of capabilities available to a SKU in specific zones

name.description:
Gets the set of zones that the SKU is available in with the
specified capabilities.

capabilities.description:
Gets a list of capabilities that are available for the SKU in the
specified list of zones.

ResourceSkuRestrictionInfo.description: Information about the restriction where the SKU cannot be used

locations.description: Gets locations where the SKU is restricted

zones.description: Gets list of availability zones where the SKU is restricted.

value.description: Gets an invariant if the feature is measured by quantity.

GatewayApiMetadataProperties.description: API metadata property for Spring Cloud Gateway

title.description: Title describing the context of the APIs available on the Gateway instance (default: `Spring Cloud Gateway for K8S`)

description.description: Detailed description of the APIs available on the Gateway instance (default: `Generated OpenAPI 3 document that describes the API routes configured.`)

documentation.description: Location of additional documentation for the APIs available on the Gateway instance

version.description: Version of APIs available on this Gateway instance (default: `unspecified`).

serverUrl.description: Base URL that API consumers will use to access APIs on the Gateway instance.

allowedOrigins.description: Allowed origins to make cross-site requests. The special value `*` allows all domains.

allowedMethods.description: Allowed HTTP methods on cross-site requests. The special value `*` allows all methods. If not set, `GET` and `HEAD` are allowed by default.

allowedHeaders.description: Allowed headers in cross-site requests. The special value `*` allows actual requests to send any header.

maxAge.description: How long, in seconds, the response from a pre-flight request can be cached by clients.

allowCredentials.description: Whether user credentials are supported on cross-site requests. Valid values: `true`, `false`.

exposedHeaders.description: HTTP response headers to expose for cross-site requests.

GatewayApiRoute.description: API route config of the Spring Cloud Gateway

title.description: A title, will be applied to methods in the generated OpenAPI documentation.

description.description: A description, will be applied to methods in the generated OpenAPI documentation.

tokenRelay.description: Pass currently-authenticated user's identity token to application service, default is 'false'

predicates.description: A number of conditions to evaluate a route for each request. Each predicate may be evaluated against request headers and parameter values. All of the predicates associated with a route must evaluate to true for the route to be matched to the request.

filters.description: To modify the request before sending it to the target endpoint, or the received response.

tags.description: Classification tags, will be applied to methods in the generated OpenAPI documentation.

GatewayRouteConfigResourceCollection.description: Object that includes an array of Spring Cloud Gateway route config resources and a possible link for next set

value.description: Collection of Spring Cloud Gateway route config resources

nextLink.description:
URL client should use to fetch the next page (per server side paging).
It's null for now, added for future use.

GatewayCustomDomainResource.description: Custom domain of the Spring Cloud Gateway

GatewayCustomDomainProperties.description: The properties of custom domain for Spring Cloud Gateway

GatewayCustomDomainResourceCollection.description: Object that includes an array of Spring Cloud Gateway custom domain resources and a possible link for next set

value.description: Collection of Spring Cloud Gateway custom domain resources

nextLink.description:
URL client should use to fetch the next page (per server side paging).
It's null for now, added for future use.

ApiPortalResourceCollection.description: Object that includes an array of API portal resources and a possible link for next set

nextLink.description:
URL client should use to fetch the next page (per server side paging).
It's null for now, added for future use.

sku.description: Sku of the API portal resource

public.description: Indicates whether the API portal exposes endpoint.

url.description: URL of the API portal, exposed when 'public' is true.

httpsOnly.description: Indicate if only https is allowed.

gatewayIds.description: The array of resource Ids of gateway to integrate with API portal.

sourceUrls.description: Collection of OpenAPI source URL locations.

resourceRequests.description: The requested resource quantity for required CPU and Memory.

instances.description: Collection of instances belong to API portal.

ApiPortalResourceRequests.description: Resource requests of the API portal

cpu.description: Cpu allocated to each API portal instance

memory.description: Memory allocated to each API portal instance

ApiPortalInstance.description: Collection of instances belong to the API portal

name.description: Name of the API portal instance

status.description: Status of the API portal instance

ApiPortalCustomDomainResource.description: Custom domain of the API portal

ApiPortalCustomDomainProperties.description: The properties of custom domain for API portal

ApiPortalCustomDomainResourceCollection.description: Object that includes an array of API portal custom domain resources and a possible link for next set

value.description: Collection of API portal custom domain resources

nextLink.description:
URL client should use to fetch the next page (per server side paging).
It's null for now, added for future use.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for this operation.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Gets subscription ID which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.

ServiceNameParameter.description: The name of the Service resource.
